value.title: China's Didi launches delivery service after coronavirus hammers ride-hailing demand
value.excerpt: China’s Didi Chuxing said on Monday it had launched delivery services in 21 Chinese cities, a move it hopes will provide its drivers with more income after the coronavirus epidemic battered ride-hailing demand.

value.title: Locked down in Beijing, I watched China beat back the coronavirus
value.excerpt: I knew then: Beijing was slowly, unmistakably, returning to normal. Six weeks earlier, I had watched China shut itself down as the coronavirus epidemic first exploded in Wuhan, and then spilled across the country and beyond. For my work, I traveled around China, down empty boulevards, through empty airports, in empty train cars. I saw China’s ...

value.title: How China is planning to use the coronavirus crisis to its advantage
value.excerpt: In Washington, there’s a lot of talk about how the coronavirus crisis could increase the push for more economic decoupling with China. But the Chinese government is thinking about it in exactly the opposite way. Beijing is preparing to use the crisis to advance China’s economic strategy against us. We better start taking notice. value.title: How Beijing reframed the coronavirus response narrative
value.excerpt: The coronavirus outbreak started as a propaganda disaster for the Chinese government. But now — with the number of new cases falling sharply in China and rising quickly in the US and Europe — Beijing has reframed the narrative. China’s new story points to the Communist party’s success in taking draconian measures to control the disease ...
